name: SES Global
description: SES Global is a satellite operator headquartered in Betzdorf, Luxembourg. The company was founded in 1985 by a group of telecommunications pioneers. name: SFR
description: SFR is a telecommunications company based in France. It offers a range of services including mobile and internet access, as well as security solutions for homes. The company provides various mobile subscription plans, including options for international travelers and family data sharing. SFR also markets a new home security service in partnership with Europ Assistance, which includes professional monitoring and a customizable video alert pack. The company features a selection of smartphones, including the latest iPhone models such as the iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro, as well as popular Android devices like the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip6 and Xiaomi Redmi Note 14. SFR promotes a mobile trade-in program that offers bonuses for eligible devices. The company emphasizes the importance of broadband speed tests and offers information on different internet technologies. SFR's offerings are designed to cater to a diverse customer base, including both individual consumers and families. The company has strategic partnerships that enhance its service offerings, particularly in home security. SFR's distribution channels include online sales through its official website. The company also provides refurbished phones as part of its product range. SFR's revenue streams are derived from mobile subscriptions, internet services, and security solutions. The company actively promotes discounts and special offers for existing customers. SFR is positioned in a competitive market, facing rivals that include other telecommunications providers. The company continues to innovate and expand its product lineup to meet customer demands. SFR's commitment to technology and customer service is evident in its diverse offerings and partnerships.

name: Sekom Iletisim sistemleri
description: Sekom Iletisim Sistemleri, founded in 1992, is a digital transformation integrator headquartered in Turkey. The company has a strong focus on customer and employee satisfaction. Sekom initially specialized in communication technologies that were in their infancy at the time of establishment. Over the years, it has expanded its expertise to include cloud computing, integrated communication, video, and data center services. Sekom serves various customer segments, including public, defense, corporate, and service provider markets. The company operates offices in Ankara, Istanbul, Izmir, Adana, and the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus, employing more than 130 expert staff. Sekom has been in a strategic business partnership with Soitron, a leading system integrator in Central and Eastern Europe, since 2012. This partnership aims to foster cooperation and synergy in services, product development, software, and expertise. Sekom was the first Cisco Business Partner in Turkey and the second globally to receive the Cisco Cable Specialized Partner designation. The company’s operations comply with the ISO 9001 Quality Standard. Sekom has been recognized among the 50 fastest-growing technology companies in the Deloitte Fast 50. The company established a Security Business Unit after the Uya Bilişim AŞ team joined Sekom, forming partnerships with various cybersecurity firms, including Check Point and Proofpoint. Sekom has also undergone organizational changes to facilitate separate teams for Enterprise and Service Provider solutions. It has developed a diverse portfolio of solutions that add value to its clients' core business areas. The company’s strategic moves and partnerships have positioned it well within the competitive landscape of technology integration.

name: SBS Television
description: SBS Television, officially known as the Special Broadcasting Service (SBS), is headquartered in Australia. The organization was founded in 1978. SBS is a government-funded public broadcasting service that focuses on multicultural and multilingual programming. SBS launched its first television service in 1980, and it has since expanded to include various digital platforms. name: Siemens
description: Siemens is a global technology company headquartered in Munich, Germany. It was founded in 1847 by Werner von Siemens and Johann Georg Halske. name: Setar

name: Seven Network
description: Seven Network is a prominent media company in Australia, officially known as Seven West Media Limited. The company is headquartered in Sydney, Australia. Seven West Media was founded in 2007 through the merger of the Seven Network and West Australian Newspapers. It operates as a publicly traded entity on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) under the ticker symbol SWM. The company provides a range of products and services, including broadcast television, publishing, and digital content. Seven West Media launched its flagship television channel, the Seven Network, in 1956. The company also offers digital platforms, including 7plus, which was launched in 2017 as an on-demand streaming service. Seven West Media targets a diverse customer base, including viewers across various demographics in Australia. The company generates revenue through advertising, subscription services, and content production. Major clients include advertisers from various sectors, leveraging the company's extensive reach to over 19 million people monthly. Seven West Media has established key partnerships with various content creators and distributors to enhance its service offerings. In recent years, the company has made strategic moves, including the acquisition of regional television stations to expand its market presence. As of October 2023, Seven West Media reported an annual recurring revenue (ARR) of approximately AUD 1.3 billion. The company competes with other major media organizations in Australia, including Nine Entertainment and Network Ten, which collectively shape the competitive landscape of the industry. Seven West Media continues to innovate in the digital space, adapting to changing consumer preferences and technological advancements. The company employs a significant workforce, contributing to its operational capabilities and service delivery.

name: Sigma
description: Sigma is a Japanese manufacturer of photographic lenses and cameras, headquartered in Kanagawa, Japan. The company was founded in 1961 by Michihiro Yamaki and has been family-owned since its inception. Today, Sigma is managed by his son, Kazuto Yamaki. The company's sole manufacturing base is its factory in Aizu, Fukushima, which was established in 1973. Sigma's production process encompasses every step from initial concept to optical engineering, product assembly, quality control, and parts sourcing, all conducted in Japan. This approach allows for seamless collaboration across departments and rigorous quality control at every stage of production. Sigma emphasizes quality and innovation, manufacturing each lens, camera, and accessory to meet high expectations. The company targets photographers and filmmakers, providing them with powerful and long-lasting tools to realize their creative visions. Sigma values diversity and aims to contribute to the well-being and happiness of people globally. The company has a deep connection to the Tohoku region, supporting local culture and technology. Sigma's product offerings include a range of photographic equipment, although specific launch years are not mentioned. The company has expanded its sales and service network, reflecting its commitment to universal human values. Sigma has not publicly disclosed financial metrics such as annual recurring revenue (ARR), funding, valuation, or revenue figures. The company faces competition in the photographic equipment market, although specific competitors or market-share figures are not provided in the sources. Sigma's philosophy is driven by the unique nature of photography, striving to push beyond existing boundaries in the industry.

name: Saudi Broadcasting Authority (SBA)
description: The Saudi Broadcasting Authority (SBA) is a government agency in Saudi Arabia that operates with legal personality and financial independence. It is organized under the Ministry of Media. The SBA aims to convey the message of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia locally and globally through various media forms. Its mission includes enhancing the quality of radio and television performance and development. The SBA oversees several television channels, including Channel Saudi, Channel SBC, Channel Dhikrayat, Channel Al-Ikhbariya, Saudi Sports Channels, Channel Al-Quran Al-Kareem, Channel Al-Sunnah Al-Nabawiyyah, and Channel Saudi Now, all of which can be accessed through the Al-Oula platform. Additionally, it manages radio and digital channels such as Quran Radio, Jeddah Radio, Riyadh Radio, Nidaa Al-Islam Radio, Saudi Radio, Al-Ikhbariya Radio, and international Saudi radios. The SBA is recognized as a leading media organization in the production and broadcasting of Saudi content while promoting national identity. The headquarters of the SBA is located on Amr Ibn Al-Aas Street, Al-Washam, Riyadh. The agency is committed to providing high-quality content and services to its audience. It operates a diverse range of media platforms to reach various customer segments across different geographic markets. The SBA’s business model primarily revolves around broadcasting and media services, contributing to its revenue streams. The organization continues to expand its offerings and enhance its technological capabilities. The SBA's strategic initiatives aim to strengthen its position in the media landscape. The agency is focused on innovation and adapting to the evolving media environment. The SBA's commitment to excellence in broadcasting reflects its dedication to serving the Saudi community and beyond.
